gurmukhi: ਜਾਹਿਗੇ ਛਪਾੲਿ ਕੈਸੁ ਜਾਨੀ ਕੰਸ ਮਾਨ ਮਾਹਿ ੲਿਹੈ ਬਾਤ ਭਲੀ ਡਾਰੋਂ ਜਰ ਹੀ ੳੁਖਾਰਕੈ ॥੩੯॥
transliteration: Jaahege Chhapaae Kais(u) Jaanikans Maan(i) Ihai Baat Bhali Ddaron Jar Hioukhooaar-kai||39||
translation: Till what time, this fact will be kept concealed? And he will be able to save himself? Therefore, he will be within his right to destroy instantly this very root of fear.39.

gurmukhi: ਕੰਸ ਦੁਹੂ ਕੇ ਬਧ ਨਮਿਤ ਲੀਨੋ ਖੜਗ ਨਿਕਾਰ ॥ ਬਾਸਦੇਵ ਅਰੁ ਦੇਵਕੀ ਡਰੇ ਦੋੳੂ ਨਰਿ ਨਾਰ ॥੪੦॥
transliteration: Kans Duhoo Ke Badh Namit Leeno Khadag Nikaar|| Baasdev Ar(u) Devakidare Dooo Nar(i) Naar||40||
translation: Kansa took out his sword in order to kill both of them and seeing this both husband and wife were frightened.40.
Speech of Vasudev addressed to Kansa:

gurmukhi: ਬਾਸਦੇਵ ਡਰ ਮਾਨ ਕੈ ਤਾਸੋ ਕਹੀ ਸੁਨਾੲਿ ॥ ਜੋ ਯਾਹੀ ਤੇ ਜਨਮ ਹੈ ਮਾਰਹੁ ਤਾਕਹੁ ਰਾੲਿ ॥੪੧॥
transliteration: Baasdev Dar Maan Kai Taaso Kahisounaae|| Jo Yaahite Janam Hai Daroh Taakoh Rdare||41||
translation: Absorbed in fear, Vasudev said to Kansa, “Do not kill Devaki, but O king ! whosoever will be born to her, you may kill him.”41.
Speech of Kansa in his mind:

gurmukhi: ਪੁਤ੍ਰ ਹੇਤ ਕੇ ਭਾਵ ਸੌ ਮਤਿ ੲਿਹ ਜਾੲਿ ਛਪਾੲਿ ॥ ਬੰਦੀਖਾਨੇ ਦੇੳੁ ੲਿਨ ੲਿਹੈ ਬਿਚਾਰੀ ਰਾੲਿ ॥੪੨॥
transliteration: Poutra Het Ke Bhaav Su Mat(i) Eh Jaae Chhapaae|| Bandee-khaane Deo In Ihai Bichaariraae||42||
translation: May it not happen that under the impact of her affection for her son, she may hide offspring from me, therefore I feel that they may be imprisoned.42.
Description about the Imprisonment of Devaki and Vasudev

gurmukhi: ਡਾਰ ਜੰਜੀਰ ਲੲੇ ਤਿਨ ਪਾੲਿਨ ਪੈ ਫਿਰਕੈ ਮਥਰਾ ਮਹਿ ਅਾਯੋ ॥ ਸੋ ਸੁਨਿਕੈ ਸਭ ਲੋਗ ਕਥਾ ਅਤਿ ਨਾਮ ਬੁਰੋ ਜਗ ਮੈ ਬਿਕਰਾਯੋ ॥
transliteration: Daar Janjeer Lae Tin Paain Pai Phirkai Mathraa Maih Aayo|| So Soun(i)kai Sahh Log Kathaa At(i) Naam Buro Jag Mai Bikraayo||
translation: Putting chains in their feet Kansa brought them back to Mathura and when the people came to know about it, they greatly talked ill of Kansa;

gurmukhi: ਅਾਨ ਰਖੈ ਗ੍ਹ ਅਾਪਨ ਮੈ ਰਖਵਾਰੀ ਕੋ ਸੇਵਕ ਲੋਗ ਬੈਠਾਯੋ ॥ ਅਾਨ ਬਡੇਨ ਕੀ ਛਾਡ ਦੲੀ ਕੁਲ ਭੀਤਰ ਅਾਪਨੋ ਰਾਹ ਚਲਾਯੋ ॥੪੩॥
transliteration: An Rakhai Grah Aapan Mai Rakhvaariko Sevak Log Baithaayo|| Oon Rakhai Grah Aapan Mai Rakhvaari Ko Sevak Log Baithaayo|| Oon Baden Kichhaad Daikul Bheetar Aapano Raah Chalaayo||43||
translation: Kansa dept them imprisoned in his own house and forsaking the traditions of his elders, he engaged servants to keep a watch over them and bound them to submit to his orders, remaining fully under his control.43.
